did.unittitle: Davidson Taylor Journals,

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Journals and notes kept by Taylor during his directorship of the Arts Center Program at Columbia University. One of the volumes relates to the Rodgers and Hammerstein Theatre proposal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 2 series:

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: 2-5. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Davidson Taylor Journlas, Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

did.unittitle: Series I: Cataloged Correspondence
Wheelock, John Hall To Davidson and Mary Elizabeth, [Long Island, NY], 25 December 1961
Wheelock, John Hall Song, Long Island, NY, August 1961
St. Bartholomew's Church A Memorial Service for Davidson Taylor, New York, 19 September 1979
Series II: Journals
Subseries II.1: Journal 1

Index of contents followed by "Interviews" with Douglas More; Erik Barnouw; Richard Rodgers; Eric Bentley; Benjamin Buttenwiser; Ben Sonnenberg; and Jacques Barzun, etc., [New York], 19 May - 25 August 1959
Subseries II.2: Journal 2

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Erpf; Barnouw; Collins; Hibbitt; Kimball; Lavan; Moore; Palmer; Schapiro; Schuster; Upjohn; Ussachevsky; Wittkower; etc. [New York], 27 August-27 November 1959
Subseries II.3: Journal 3

Index of contents followed by transcripts of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Erpf; Bell; Dietz; Handleman; Keene; Kirstein; Lambert; Matthews; Owens; Phillips; Rodgers; Schapiro; Schnitzer; Trottenberg; Warren; Young, etc., [New York], 2 December 1959-13 May 1960
Subseries II.4: Journal 4

"In this volume, the Rodgers and Hammerstein Theatre negotiations begin. This material is separated and kept in [this] small volume. Material about the Theatre in this volume copied f[rom] other one. All entries in small volume appear in this index through the closing date of this volume.", [New York], 12 May-18 November 1960
Subseries II.5: Journal 5
Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Krpf; Reisinger; etc., [New York], 16 November 1960 - 12 April 1961
Subseries II.6: Journal 6

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Bentley; Dale; Krim; Lehman; Warburg; etc., [New York], 17 April - 30 October 1961
Subseries II.7: Journal 7

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Astor; Beaumont; Cerf; Kempner; Loos; Mazur; Naumburg; Rodgers and Hammerstein; Rosenwald; Sonnenberg; etc. [New York], 16 October 1961 - 12 March 1962
Subseries II.8: Journal 8

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Beaumont; Bentley; Delacorte; Farrell; Haas; Luce; McLeish; Podell; Simon; Vogel; etc., [New York], 13 March - 15 June 1962
Subseries II.9: Journal 9

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Beaumont; Bentley; Carman; Hogan; Inness-Brown; Luce; Mielziner; Palmer; Segal; Tyson; Wertheim; Xanthos; etc., [New York], June 18 - 20 November 1962
Subseries II.10: Journal 10

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Beeson; Calvert; de Barry; Hammer; Milburn; Papp; Teichmann; Valency; etc., [New York], 26 November - 4 March 1962
Subseries II.11: Journal 11

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Alexander; Bornemann; Dowling; Friedberg; Houghton; Matthews; Moe; Pool; Redman; Salvatore; Teighman; Vogel; Wrightsman; etc, [New York], 3 March - 26 August 1963
Subseries II.12: Journal 12

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Barnouw; Compton; Hale; Leff; Moe; Park; Snow; Truman; Woodbridge, etc., [New York], 3 September 1963 - 30 June 1964
Subseries II.13: Journal 13

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Barzun; Coffee; Hadyn; Koch; Lowry; Park; Raynal; Shanet; Vogel; Warren; Wittower; Xanthos, [New York], 13 July 1964 - 20 October 1965
Subseries II.14: Journal 14

Index of contents followed by notes of talks with various professors, administrators, and supporters: Kirk; Barzun; Salmen; Barnouw; Deane; Leary; McCabe; Shanet; Swann; Teichman; Walton, etc., [New York], 1 November 1965 - 24 June 1968
Subseries II.15: Journal [15]
Notes on conversations and discussions with various people at Columbia University and outside regarding the Rodgers and Hammerstein Theatre project., [New York], 9 September 1960 - 18 July 1963
